ETYMOLOGY: From Middle English ruine, from Old French ruine, from Latin ruīna ('a falling down, collapse, downfall'), from ruō ('I fall, rush, tumble').

MEANINGS.POS_TIP: Transitive verb: a verb that requires a direct object to complete its meaning.
MEANINGS.DEF_EN: To damage or destroy something completely; to cause someone to lose all their money or status.
MEANINGS.DEF_ZH: 彻底地破坏或摧毁某物；导致某人失去所有金钱或地位。
MEANINGS.SENT_EN: The sudden economic collapse ruined many small businesses.
MEANINGS.SENT_ZH: 突如其来的经济崩溃摧毁了许多小企业。

MEANINGS.POS_TIP: Transitive verb: a verb that requires a direct object to complete its meaning.
MEANINGS.DEF_EN: To spoil or impair something so that it is no longer enjoyable or successful.
MEANINGS.DEF_ZH: 败坏或损害某物，使其不再令人愉快或不再成功。
MEANINGS.SENT_EN: His thoughtless comment ruined the entire evening.
MEANINGS.SENT_ZH: 他那不经意的评论毁了整个晚会。

MEANINGS.POS_TIP: Noun: a word (other than a pronoun) used to identify any of a class of people, places, or things (common noun), or to name a particular one of these (proper noun).
MEANINGS.DEF_EN: The physical remains of a building or city that has suffered destruction or decay; the state of being completely destroyed.
MEANINGS.DEF_ZH: 遭受破坏或腐朽的建筑物或城市的物质残骸；彻底毁坏的状态。
MEANINGS.SENT_EN: We visited the ancient ruins of the Roman forum.
MEANINGS.SENT_ZH: 我们参观了古罗马广场的遗址。

MEANINGS.POS_TIP: Noun: a word (other than a pronoun) used to identify any of a class of people, places, or things (common noun), or to name a particular one of these (proper noun).
MEANINGS.DEF_EN: The complete loss of wealth, position, or happiness; the factor that causes this downfall.
MEANINGS.DEF_ZH: 财富、地位或幸福的彻底丧失；导致这种衰落的因素。
MEANINGS.SENT_EN: His obsession with gambling proved to be his ultimate ruin.
MEANINGS.SENT_ZH: 他对赌博的痴迷最终被证明是他的毁灭。

REGISTER: General usage, common in both formal and informal contexts.
